bioghist.p: "The Cleric" of Pittsburgh, PA, and vicinity first met in 1894. The object was "the development of Christian fellowship and culture among the members of the Cleric."

scopecontent.p: This collection contains minutes from 1965-2001, which include originals, photocopies and transcriptions. There are also treatises 1980-2001. Some of the titles include: "Multiple Intelligences and Communicating the Good Word," "The Black Idiom in the Music of America," "The Electronic Great Awakening," "Uncreative Conflict: the Creationist-Evolutionist Controversy," and "Judo, the Gentle Way." In addition, there are rosters, 1965-2001 (listing programs for each meeting and members of the Cleric), and attendance records and constitutions, 1964, 1984, and 1990.
